column11: Review Text

column8: Mini position without snorkel or swimming spot
column11: Small local beach full of sunbeds and a small children's pool where you can cool off. We didn't think it was worth the walk. Not suitable for snorkeling or swimming.

column8: Nice enough, be careful of the dog on the way back down.
column11: Nice little place with an overpriced bar. Just be careful if you walk it back down the hill as there is a snappy 'stray perhaps' dog that may bark at you and nip at your skin. Poor local kid started to run back the other way. Me? Rabies  injections now needed.

Loved it, we went late afternoon for a few hours. Enjoyed a Pina Colda and watched the sunset. Maybe it was the time of day, we enjoyed a chilled few hours enjoying the last bit of sunshine. Walked back to our hotel. Unclear why so many bad reviews, glad it didn't put us off visiting.

The views here are absolutely stunning, but be aware that the beach area is quite small and often crowded. Most of the space is managed by few restaurants, which means access is Somewhat provided through their land.  If you're planning to dine or grab a drink, be prepared for steep prices ‚Äî a 400ml Coke, for instance, can cost up to Rs.800, plus an additional 10% tax. It‚Äôs worth noting that these prices may feel excessive, even for international visitors, as you're essentially paying for the privilege of being on their property. I would vote Mirissa beach over this for so many reasons.
Good to say you have been but ultimately dirty and not that great. The rest of Mirissa and Sri Lanka loads better... The walk is hard work also.

we was stayed there 3 nights all is wonderfull Location is wonderfull  and food is Avarage specially their  breakfast is perfect  .Room is nice and well enoug space staff is so kind and helped us since we are checked in .specially the manager he arranged our air port pick up and drop very reasonable price as well as whale wtaching tour . we had some dark pictue about this hotel and some of facts while we are reading some reviews  but it completly changed we are highy suggest this place everyone .
Nice beach BUT not so secret. Lots of people on the beach and in the tiny lagoon. Lots of sun beds, crowded. If you want to go there, go early.

column8: Only trying to rip off tourists
column11: We went there as locals. They say its a private beach even though no beach is private in sri lanka. They only want to rip-off tourists, I guess. After this we find out we are not the first

The beach itself is very crowded and lying on deck. In addition, the waves are very high and it is not possible to snorkel as we thought. The staff at the restaurants are very friendly. The way there goes up a mountain, but it is good to run.
extremely racist place and terible hospitality. very unwelcoming Food is not great and Very over priced not worth it..
Apathied polcies. Sri Lankans and Asians are not welcome. If you're local, you need to spend a minimun of USD 100 to remain there.
This small cove could be so peaceful where children and adults could swim serenely because protected from the waves but a club decided otherwise. The music can be heard from afar... Forget the nap!
The beach is not clean, there‚Äôs waste everywhere. Overcrowded. Starving dogs all around, also wounded and bleeding into the sand. Horrible horrible experience, not worth it!

The beach itself is so clean and peaceful, however it takes a bit of walking uphill so it could be a bit tiring, and not all tuktuks agree to go there as the hill is so stippling. I wouldn‚Äôt rate it that much as there are as beautiful other beaches to enjoy with less hiking effort .
The place is beautiful but business and tourists have made it a not worth place to visit...crowded and with very loud disco music...nature beautiful places deserve a better treatment

We took a tuc tuc here from the Weligama Spa Hotel where they have a lovely clean and tidy beach, but I just wanted to go see this place as it intrigued me. Tuc tuc driver says he needs to take up a steep hill to get there. Okay, he asked if we wanted him to wait to take us back when we got there and I could see why. We asked for 10 minutes to take photos and so glad we did not stay. From what I could see after walking through an open type cafe bar was a small rock pool with some sand and rocks to the sides. It seemed dirty and in disarray! Some old type wooden sunbeds. It seemed to be a young back packers place which is good for them but not me. Took our photos and left with our tuc tuc guy who took us to the harbour for photo there and then dropped us off at Mirissa Beach. Bit disappointed in that also with some rough and ready cafe bars along the way, but beach seemed ok. Popped into a beach bar but it was filthy.  Walked a bit then got another tuc tuc back to where we felt safe and to a clean and tidy great beach with the surfing waves.

Secret Beach is a tranquil and peaceful place where the waves are friendly and the views are great; the adjacent restaurant are free to sit in as long as you order food or drinks through the quality is average. None the less the beach is a great spot to chill. Keep in mind upon reaching you have to walk or take tuktuk for upto 1KM to reach the beach

Obviously it is not a secret beach at all and, indeed, it is well known. If you decide to go, remember to go very early or you will not find a place. There are deck chairs and sun loungers as well as tables and umbrellas, the bay is sheltered and you will have the opportunity to enjoy a few hours of sea.
Not recommended. Very bad people. They have cameras on recording in their changing rooms. They don‚Äôt even accept it. Please don‚Äôt go there

The beach is tiny, we were there in August with big waves during the south monsoon, so hardly swimmable...... But it's still happening üòÅ The most disappointing thing is that at 10:00 am all the deckchairs are already lined up ready to pick tourists like gogos üôÑüôÑ...... You will have understood Secret Beach no longer has the charm of the small isolated cove that we are entitled to expect..... So make no mistake üòúüòú
It's great with kids and those who like trekking. Like an adventure walk.bthere are two paths- one to cliff and one to beach.
A heavenly place, which is worth it! The staff takes great care and the food is very good. The deckchairs are free üòâ Little advice, watch out for sea urchins

The beach is not secret nor is it certainly worth visiting. There are only two beach bars that occupy the entire beach. When they saw us putting a towel in the part where there were no chairs or tables, they began to put chairs and tables until they filled the entire beach of their beach bar. You couldn't even put a towel on it. A quarter taker. Take the opportunity to go to other beaches with fewer people if what you are looking for is a bit of tranquility. Do not waste your time.

I walked out here from Marissa beach to get my steps in. Small private area with restaurant, tables & chairs and rammed with sunbeds. The area of water is akin to a rockpool but the swell does come through an opening catching many by surprise who occupied sunbeds close to the water's edge. I sat at a table. I read another comment stating they charged for use of a sunbed which is not the norm. The food prices are over the top as are the milkshakes & juices so I only had one coke (most I've paid for) whilst I was there. It is a unique setting for sure albeit an expensive one. Finally, a tuk tuk back to Mirissa beach, a distance of 2kms cost 1000 rupees. Again another overpriced service. Been there done that won't ever be returning.

Beautiful beach, but once you've seen it is enough... The loungers are so close together, much too crowded. After waiting half an hour for our drink, we left. Secret is not what you imagine it to be like. Sri Lanka has nicer beaches, we certainly won't be coming back to this beach.
Funny old place! No sea access so you have to swim in a large rock pool which is ok. Loud Ibiza tunes from the restaurant where you have to hire sun beds. Beautiful but not as great as Turtle beach.

Do not go here. Do not take your kids here. There is nothing to see here, really. It is not at all the paradisiacal secluded spot you have read. There is absolutely NOTHING to see here; please move on.

It's a small sandy beach, but if you are expecting space and tranquility you are likely to be disappointed. There is very little space due to the number of sun loungers and the shacks at the back of the beach play music albeit not too loud. It wasn't what we expected and felt it wasn't worth the trek to get to it.
Lovely and clean Beach, Food was good, mornings are Great as its very quiet, on your way back check out the colorful Harbour .
For me it was a really great beach, there was not much going on and it wasn't that crowded, you get a lounger for a drink and you can also pull it into the shade.

Secret beach bar has no trip advisor reviews so will write one . Secret Beach Bar is not for everyone. Remember, you are in Sri Lanka, not in Mykonos. Workers operate at their own pace and may ask you for marijuana; politely decline if you‚Äôre not interested. Workers also indulge in smoking. It‚Äôs a laid-back atmosphere with a small private bay. Avoid striving for the perfect Instagram photo, as the waves can catch you off guard. A unique place that you don‚Äôt come across every day.
Is it really secret if there are signs every where? :D When I went there during the afternoon I found it to be less crowded than the normal beach. I enjoyed that. The waves were pretty strong though.
One of the most secluded yet serene places offering the absolute best of Mirissa. Not at all easy to find (especially in the condition we were in) but it was worth it

Nice, but if you don't land here, you won't miss anything. Very small. In high season you'll definitely not get a spot or you'll be stuck close together. Every other beach in the south is much nicer. We saw 2 peacocks on the way to the beach, that was the highlight. ü¶ö

The beach is located in a somewhat remote location. It is also accessible by tuk tuk. You can also go on foot like we did. The road is really not the most beautiful, but it is possible. There is a bar with food and drinks on the beach. We were a little disappointed with the bar, as the prices, especially for food, are much higher than normal. During this period, there were not many people so the scene was very relaxing. The water is not very deep, but it is protected from waves like a swimming pool. maybe we expected a little more, but overall it was a nice experience.
Amazing views, so relaxed and the staff are great guys, Danuka made us feel so welcome. The staff were all friendly and could not do more to help, they could all work in 5 star hotels

It certainly is one of the best spots in Mirissa. It's calm and very beautiful. Take Harbor road from Mirissa and after about a 10 minute walk you'll arrive. Do not take a tuk unless you have to cuz 600 bucks is a rip-off. There is one small caf√© in Secret beach but it is extremely expensive compared to the ones on the main road.  My recommendation is to take a beer from your local wine store and have a small drink. BUT MAKE SURE YOU BRING THE CAN BACK.

A small sandy/rocky beach surrounded by rocks that prevent the waves and gives you a nice relaxing experience. Local shops present to serve food and drinks. Though a bit expensive compared to other places.
Overrated Beach. Maybe it was a nice place once, but now it's really dirty. The guys who operate the Bar couldn't care less if you're there or not, if it's dirty or not.

The amazing "secret beach" was one of my best places in Sri Lanka!!! The place is so beautiful as a small part of paradise! The sea is always calm and you can enjoy a nice swim and if  it is sunset time the feeling is amazing!!!There I drank the best  passion mojito and had also nice lunches! For sure the guys who are working there, are the  best guys to met ever ! The owner is also a very good man ! Thank you guys thank you "secret beach"!!!                             Till next time...

Very small but shallow lagoon so good for children. Great for snorkelling lots of rock pools. Hard to get to and very hot, no breeze because of hill behind. Shade and sunbeds if required. Restaurant dominates the background.

hidden beach consists of two parts, one part is surrounded by rocks and very shallow water, ideal for families with small children and there are no waves, in front of it is a bar that is bearable (food) and in the other part is completely wild and can  swimming, also the road to the beach is very hard (uphill-downhill) and you can go to one part of the tuk tuk but mostly avoid to the beach to drive (500sr) and the normal price is 200sr.  once again I note that it is ideal for smaller children and lovers of quieter beaches.

–ú–µ—Å—Ç–æ –æ–±—è–∑–æ–Ω –¥–ª—è –ø–æ—Å–µ—â–µ–Ω–∏—è. –ù–æ. –û—Ñ–∏—Ü–∏–∞–Ω—Ç—ã –∏ –∞–¥–º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ç–æ—Ä –≤–µ—á–Ω–æ –ø—å—è–Ω—ã–µ –∏–ª–∏ –æ–±–∫—É—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ, –≥—Ä—É–±—è—Ç –∏ –≤—ã–≥–æ–Ω—è—é—Ç –∑–∞ –ø—Ä–µ–¥—ä—è–≤—ã –ø–æ –ø–æ–≤–æ–¥—É —Ö–∞–ª–∞—Ç–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏ –∏—Ö –∫—É—Ö–Ω–∏. The place is obligatory to visit. But. The waiters and the administrator are always drunk or stoned, rude and kicked out for presenting about the negligence of their kitchen.
This a wow - beach - so close to Mirissa city and tree top hill . Less accommodation around this area and you end up enjoying whole day sea bathing
Not as good as it was told. An average beach with big stones. If you have lot of free time, go there, otherwise, skip it.

Waste waste waste, everywhere waste. Seems like a recommend place to get rid of your garbage. Terrible, I would recommend the people, who are doing business with the bar to clean up the beach and the nature around this place.

Secret beach is faraway from the city. It was empty when we got there. There was rocks no sand. Lots of dogs which were very friendly. Nice and quiet if you want to escape from loud and crowded places .

This place is off the beaten path, about 20-30 mins walk from the main road, namely Matara Road. But it is not like its name being the ‚ÄúSecret Beach‚Äù since many tourists know this place. It is easily guided using Google Map to locate this place. Therefore it is quite crowded and the beach is rather small and narrow with not much space for good relaxation. Having said that, the beach is beautiful, rocky with big splashes from the wave and good spot for snorkelling as claimed. We just came here for a short visit for some photo takings before heading to Mirissa Beach.
Great beach for relax and for snorkeling. only thing i would like to recommend about this beach is quite nice and not much waves for swim ideal for babies and families who like to have ocean pool.
Not worth a visit! Plenty of better and easier to get to beaches. Service was slow and yes we experienced the rudeness when we didn‚Äôt tip enough

Just a 10 minute bike ride away from the main beach you‚Äôll find Mirissa‚Äôs secret beach. Although it‚Äôs not as secret as it probably used to be anymore it‚Äôs a really nice little beach where you can enjoy a nice swim at day and watch the sunset at night. On one side of the beach there is a beach bar offering food and drinks. Although the bar is pretty basic is does the trick. They brings out torches and candles when it turns dark which makes the perfect setting to enjoy the sunset.

Never ever in my life I was talk to like the waiter in secret beach bar did! It was so rude and disgraceful! I don't understand how he still works there?!  It's the guy with long hair. I would never go there again, I still get goosebumps when I think of him. Secret beach itself is small and busy.  But I think with small kids ideal because there are little water pools.
We went, we wish we had not. Dirty, infested with mangy dogs, and frankly not all that nice. I would not recommend it.

Going to Secret Beach is quite a journey, the road is terrible, the paths are a little better, but worth seeing. It's a small beach so be there to get a good spot, but forget about the food, it's not worth it. Buy some snacks earlier and you don't get disappointed by the food but drinks are ok. Also a great place for snorkelling.

We have just returned from Sri Lanka after a 3 week holiday.Secret beach is a lovely place to hang out for the day. Yes there are loads of dogs but that‚Äôs not unusual for Sri Lanka. The problem is the cafe. The main waiter/owner is so rude and when I returned my tuna salad as it was inedible he couldn‚Äôt believe it and he spent the rest of the time I was there glaring at me. The other negative reviews about him are so correct. Take a packed lunch with you or a couple of rotis. He lets the Sri Lankan  people down as they are such lovely and accommodating people. We did go a couple more times and took our own lunch but he glared at the bag when we arrived. He needs to be sacked.

We were recommended this beach and decided to go one day.  Very difficult to get there . Steep and bad road. First impression is that this is a dirty place. Most irritating were all the dogs.  They found used baby diapers and enjoyed it a lot. We didn‚Äôt. Will never go back

This is the only place so far on our one-month tour of Sri lanka where I've got really bad vibes from the staff. The beach itself is really cute, with a great little sheltered swimming spot great for babies and small children, but the only restaurant there has awful overpriced food and the staff act like they hate you being there. The chips were stale, tasted like they had reheated someone's leftovers, and just don't order pizza whatever you do. A coconut fell from a tree right in front of us narrowly missing someone lounging on one of their beds. Very dangerous and badly managed.  They could net the coconuts and/or harvest them regularly like I've seen other places do. We also saw rubbish and broken glass lying around which is a shame. The beach is definitely worth a visit, just don't go to the main restaurant. There's a little juice bar selling coconuts etc on the other side, the people there were nice. My advice is go early with towels and get a good spot under a tree, take snacks.

The beach isn‚Äôt that great Corals, rocks, knee-deep water Last year was much better The restaurant near by isn‚Äôt good, stuff is unfriendly, charge for sun beds and no food or water that you bring with you allowed
the beach is most beautiful. if u are a loner, must visit. superb clean water and a good restaurant nearby
Its now a routine to. Visit secret beach and the restaurant next to same with a natural rock pool superb for snorkling and safe for kids The food served is excellant and nice team who work thier .

It is a bit of a tricky walk and you may feel like the locals are leading you in the wrong direction. Access to the beach is free! Just a local spot which the tourists have found out about but it is a goodie. A little bay with great snorkelling. Very rocky so you wont be able to swim much, but maybe float in the shallows. But a nice relaxing beach I highly recommend visiting if you are in Mirissa for a few days. MIght be worth getting a tuk tuk if you struggle with hilly walks.

I was told by others not to come here but I really Enjoyed it. There is a bar/ restaurant that serves beers and food and a great spot to spend the afternoon. You can snorkel here as well, but can be a bit rough

The beach is ok, but the waiter (man with long hair) is crazy. I ordered mango juice and it had bad smell so I decided to return it. All of my friends tried it and said the same thing. When he came, he became so angry and constantly was giving me the bad killing look. It was uncomfortable and little bit scary. So you can really expect everything here!

I was there with a friend and when we arrived we were welcomed very nicely by one of the guys of the bar, as soon as we ordered breakfast (which was okay) instead of a main dish he started to be really rude. We really felt like we weren‚Äôt welcome at all and kind of annoying them. After few hours we ordered lunch and the food was average if not worst. He suddenly became really nice again as we were spending money. I really didn‚Äôt like this attitude. We also noticed how him and his friends were laughing at other customers when they weren‚Äôt sure if stopping by or not. The beach itself is pretty cute, only takes 20 minutes walk from the centre. If you really wanna go, bring your own drinks and food. Be aware, sun beds are 500rupees unless you order a main dish at the restaurant.
The long haired waiter was very rude and possibly drunk. He kicked 2 dogs and was very aggressive. We were served warm beers with fish smelling ice.
I don't know where to begin. The staff literally got provoked over nothing. This guy literally punched my friend in the face. Dont go there,not worth it.

Went to the beach to see a beautiful natural beach. We were greated by the rude and disrespectful bar staff that is located on the beach. The situation escalated to near violence without any provocation. Probably the worst tourist experience we ever had. There are a lot of beautiful beaches in the area - would highly recommend avoiding this one with it's terrible locals.
Not recommendable. The name promises more than it really is. The arrival is great but arrived the beach is dirty and little invite. We were there in the off season. Still not worth a visit.
The beach is beautiful but the service at the only resaturante there was the worst i had ever seen. We didn't even order anything becouse the owner of this place was so aggressive and violent.

The service was really bad. At the moment we get there one of the bartenders start yell at me just because of my nation he attacked me and told me he will love to set in present for killing Israeli. this place should permanently close ◊ô◊©◊®◊ê◊ú◊ô◊ù ◊ú◊ê ◊ú◊î◊™◊ß◊®◊ë ◊û◊ì◊ï◊ë◊® ◊ë◊û◊ß◊ï◊ù ◊©◊ï◊†◊ê ◊ô◊©◊®◊ê◊ú◊ô◊ù. ◊û◊ê◊ï◊ì ◊ú◊ê ◊°◊ô◊û◊§◊ò◊ô.

Mirissa where you can see some huge whales and nice beach to relax. It is a beautiful beach, with a relaxed and laidback atmosphere. Along the beach are plenty of small restaurants and cafes, serving delicious and fresh seafood. After dark, the restaurants put out tables on the beach, light lanterns, and candles, and serve seafood barbecues . A place where the world class waves hit the sand, where turtles inhabit the water, and where the beer is ice cold. After a week in the hill country, this is exactly what you need

This secluded little beach is very hard to get to. Make sure the tuk tuk driver takes you all the way as the walk can be quite a struggle, and it is quite steep. Lots and lots of hermit crabs on the beach to play with though.

I never seen such a beautiful beach with a lots of fun and things..The way to the beach is rather difficult to go and u cant go to the beach directly as the road is still under construction..In google u can find the directions easily and have to go through some narrow path..There were people to guide you to the beach and they asking the money..Dont want to give the money as u can find it with the help of Google and some boards..In there very less people and the beach is somewhat rough..but we had a lot of fun and so happy..Very good location to have a photo shoot..Also please dont throw any garbage and plastic bottles to there because we saw many rubbish on the way to beach and so sad about that..
This is the best place for resting in the beach . this beach is like hidden beach with beautiful scenery. what a lovely place!
Beautiful place to watch the sunset. There is also a restaurant were you can a cocktail :) Good place for a good evening.

This beach is absolutely stunning! Not perfect for sunbathing though, as there are lots of rocks, coral and tiny hermit crabs instead of sand. But the water is crystal clear, you can buy beverages or rent snorkeling gear, there are lots of cute puppies and we even witnessed some local men catch an octopus with a harpoon. One of our favorite spots in Mirissa! It's a bit of a stroll but easily doable from downtown Mirissa, we didn't find a tuk tuk necessary. Be a bit careful, if you get lost locals try to rescue you with shortcuts through their gardens and will demand money afterwards. We've made a video tutorial on how to find it from Mirissa's main street. Make sure to bring some water as the road up the hill is rather steep - best time to go is for sunset!

To find this place you have to fight with the gps and local directors. üòÅ I have put a screenshot with the easiest way to find the secret beach. This is a shallow pool, accompanied by reefs to stop the waves. Such a quiet calm place to read a book, have a relaxing time listening to the waves. There is the Secret Beach Bar, wich runs by some local beach boys who are good people. We didn't intended to buy anything as it seemed to be under construction. But they have a variety of soft beverages, mocktails, snacks etc Can reach here easily with a bike or a local tuk tuk. Road is damaged a lot. So if you drive be careful of. Children also can enjoy this place. Toilet and changing room facilities available.

What an awful experience we had at secret beach! We had only encountered lovely, kind and welcoming people on our trip to Sri Lanka so it was such a shame to visit the secret beach on our last day and come across such a vile human being! The service was TERRIBLE! I was told there was no lobster so we went ahead and ordered something different. After over an hour of waiting (and asking the waiter's serval times where our food was) and seeing people that had arrived after us receive their food including multiple people receiving lobster I went and questioned the staff. One particular member who I can only explain was either drunk or on drugs said I was lying, that I hadn't asked for lobster and that I hadn't even ordered our food!! So the kitchen did not have our order! Additionally to this (and even worse!!) my friends were asked to leave the beach because they looked like 'hippys' and had a hula hoop with them, the aggressive and enraged member of staff proceeded to tell them he didn't like the way they looked and it wasn't the look they wanted for secret beach!!! This was the final straw!! We asked him what his problem was and he got in our faces and said 'you do not want a problem with me' He had enraged bloodshot eyes and was extremely volatile. It's safe to say this man is dangerous! He then went and told the tuk tuk drivers not to take us so we had to walk back to the main street! We did nothing wrong, we were laying on the beach and up to that point had not even conversed with anyone except when we placed our food order. This was all because he didn't like the way we looked! Appalling behaviour and I strongly advise you not to go there! The beach and sea is rocky and full of sea urchins anyway so there are much nicer beaches in Sri Lanka where you won't be intimidated and threatened!

The beach is a bit of a mission to get to. We took a tuk tuk and had to walk the last couple of minutes as the road gets too rough. There are two main sections of the beach. The first one was wavy so we went around the corner and enjoyed the calm lagoon created from the rocky outcrop blocking the waves. The sand is coarse but the setting is spectacular and the calm natural pool was an awesome way to cool off. Worth visiting while you‚Äôre in Mirissa!

This gorgeous spot may not be ideal for swimming but it's very beautiful and also a great spot for snorkeling. Amazing array of fish, including two resident baby black tipped sharks that are really easy to see. There is a restaurant where you can hire sun beds for 500 LKR . Staff are totally unfriendly though. It's a great alternative/complement to the main beach and easy to get to by foot or tuk tuk.

We came here by Tuk Tuk to watch the sunset, (you get dropped off and have to walk a little way down to the beach) and enjoy the cocktails üç∏, beautiful beach very tranquil and friendly staff. Well worth a visit if you‚Äôre here in Mirissa.
Not much to do, small beach and not ideal to swim as the waves hit the rocks, but its nice to look at. It is rather hard to get here (tuk tuks struggle) and a decent walk if not.

I have quite mixed feelings about this place. The beach is very beautiful but hard to swim (lots of sharp rocks). We did not like the bar - too pricey and the quality of drinks not really high. As a bonus, the employee nearly put a table on our heads while we were packing to leave (they put more tables close to the water for the sunset). The place was quite crowded for its size, so not really a "secret". It is also quite hard to get to, so I would say it doesn't worth all the efforts.

We wouldn‚Äôt recommend Secret Beach. The scenery is beautiful (as is the rest of the Sri Lankan coast) but we don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs worth the effort to go to. There‚Äôs rocks and shells everywhere which doesn‚Äôt make for a very enjoyable swim. The southern province has a lot more other quiet and private beaches which are a lot more enjoyable. This one can remain a secret as far as we‚Äôre concerned..

1) The Beach I love the beach and was the best I had visited in Sri Lanka so far. The water was bluish green with lots of coconut trees in the back, BUT be careful! The sea is rough with lots of rocks and sea urchins in the lagoon just in front of the bar. Note that the beach is relatively far and there are steep ups and downs 2) The Bar Horrible service, one waiter (wearing blue shirt with yellow elephants) told me that I had to pay Rs 500 for sun bed even if I was ordering lunch (although another waiter told me that sun bed would be free with lunch). He said ‚Äúpay or don‚Äôt come to my restaurant, go somewhere else‚Äù. The idiot also claimed that he had seen me in the village talking badly to a shopkeeper which didn‚Äôt happen! I believe the waiter was high or drunk. I ordered a dessert and came very late, with the ice cream on top of it almost melted. The pasta was ok but expensive. The bar got its fame from social media influencers who are biased and reflect their own personal views **advise: go to the beach for 2 hours only as it‚Äôs very small. Take your own food. Don‚Äôt purchase anything from the bar. Don‚Äôt even communicate with the waiters

We visited around 4 pm and stayed for sunset. Neither of us are strong swimmers so we didn‚Äôt venture into the water but the views and peacefulness was a great change to the noisier beaches. There were people snorkelling and swimming and a bar (The secret beach bar) offering sun beds and food/drink. We took a tuk tuk there, which stopped before the road became too rough and we walked 5 mins down to the beach, on our way back the man in the bar arranged a tuk tuk that took us directly from the beach back into the town. Would highly recommend for a relaxing and beautiful sunset!

Gorgeous natural beach with limited crowds. There was a little snorkeling close to shore with a lot of different fish, sea urchins and sea grass. Further out the sea was too choppy. The beach had trees where you could sit in the shade and the water was fantastic for swimming.

It is very nice place to see sunset. Good walking distance from Mirissa beach. The beach is really small. There is also one bar on the beach so you can refresh yourselves after your walk from Mirissa. If you don't want to walk, tuk tuk is able to get there.

When you are near of the beach and arriving by your own vehicle, there is people who want to sell you parking space. They tell that you cannot drive there. THIS IS NOT TRUE ! Road there is rough, but you can totally drive there by bike/scooter/tuktuk, like local people do. There are also little kids asking for money. This is sad that their parents have teached this. Do not give money !

This place is a beautiful and also away from the main beach of the mirissa. That's a plus point if you looking for relax in a secret beach. Calm and cool too.. you should go with some shoes as well. t is a small beach with lots of rocks and corals. there weren‚Äôt anything for the kids to enjoy. Couldn‚Äôt even swim because of the rocks and huge waves
A not so secret beach, but a lovely one for a lazy day. Not very crowded and very good food at the bar.
The secret beach is a beautiful and relaxing place away from the hustle and bustle of the main beach area. Beautiful at sunset.

This place is nice but it really wasn't anything special. You must go here with water shoes as well. Thankfully we had our but if you don't everything from the beach to the water is full of rock, coral, and shells. It does make for decent snorkeling but you cant really see many fish just coral.

If you're a fan of underwater world spending your holidays in Mirissa, you should definitely head to the Secret Beach and enjoy the multitude of beautiful fish in the ocean! While Mirissa main beach has great waves, The Secret Beach is much better for snorkelling. There is plenty of sea urchins too so shoes may be a good idea:) There is one bar at the beach; while the food is not great, you can use their sunbeds for free if you eat lunch there. Otherwise it costs 500 lkr/sunbed.
Wonderful sunset view on the rocks right infront the beach. We didnt visit the restaurant. Its a good idea to hop by just if u are looking for a nice one hour sunset experience with your travelmates.

There's nothing special about this beach, and it's definitely not a secret! It's off the beaten track, so a little difficult to get to - but signposts all the way (no secrecy). The beach consists of broken coral, not nice soft sand. You really need water/reef shoes to go in the sea as there's many rocks. The only cafe/bar there has terrible service - we waited 20 mins for a beer and 1 hour for a sandwich!! I wouldn't waste your time visiting here, there are much nicer places in the area.

Follow the hand-painted signs from the harbor. It's a lovely up and down walk that is only spoiled by the heat. Once there, there's a small sandy cove to one side for swimming and a rocky cove to the other with a sandy strip to relax on. They are separated by a rocky outcrop. Very picturesque. There's a decent bar on the rocky side so you can sit in the shade and enjoy the fantastic views. Tuk-Tuks are available should the return trek after a few beers not seem too attractive!

Cute little beach quite far from Mirissa beach, not a must see but if you want to take a walk you might as well. Swimming, beaches and restaurants are better in Mirissa and this place is still quite crowded.

This beach is about a 30 min walk from the main beach. The upside is that it is a little quieter than Marissa and there is a cafe at the beach. The down side is it is a small beach with lots of rocks and coral, it's still pretty but meh, Marissa is too. We caught a tuk tuk back, it seems the starting price is 500 rupee but we got it for 250.

Accessible by road but it's also fun to climb and follow the signs on the road leading to the beach. The dogs don't bother you if you do not provoke or fight them. It's a secluded cozy beach surrounded by rocks and lush palm trees. Great for pictures. Snorkels were available on the beach when we visited and were rented out by a kind lady with her cute son. Say hi to them. Some colourful fish can be seen quite close to the shore. If you wanna swim there's an area near the entrance without large rocks or sea urchins where you can take a dip. The far end side has both rocks and sea urchins so may not be good for a swim but can be used to sunbathe and click some nice pictures. Didn't visit the bar or restaurant.

My review is about the location not this restaurant. You can‚Äôt here - look at the pics; so many rocks etc. we were so disappointed when we arrived and wasted a good hour + money on a tuk tuk getting here. Give it a miss!
fantastic beach. Very nice beautiful corals and small fish you can really enjoy the day. The food at the restaurant was cheap and great.

Honestly, there are so many beautiful beaches in Sri Lanka I suggest you skip this spot all together.  That being said the beach is good for snorkeling (only if you are a good swimmer and not afraid of rocks and coral).  BUT, NO MATTER WHAT DO NOT GIVE A CENT TO SECRET BEACH BAR.  See other "terrible" reviews.  The owner is AWFUL.  We ordered the most expensive thing on the menu, the seafood platter (which was just a waste of money) in addition to three beers, two salads and the shrimp starter.  I only mention that we ordered something expensive because I can't imagine why he would assume we were wealthy for any other reason.  First THE SERVICE IS AWFUL.  We actually thought they were friendly at first as this was our only experience with really outright rude people in Sri Lanka and we spent a month traveling around the whole country but they are just SUPER SARCASTIC AND RUDE RUDE RUDE.  The owner mentioned service was not included when we paid and while it isn't much (he only gave me change as 1000 rupees and 100) I left the 100 for the guys in the kitchen.  He proceeded to make lots of jokes about the money (my sister actually thought he was joking around at first and was shocked when she realized he wasn't) and how we were rich and MUCH MORE but that is all the energy I'm giving this dude and his place.  Seriously DON'T GO TO THE BAR, you can bring your own drinks from outside and enjoy the beach without sun beds. - beach is nice but there are plenty of just as nice and nicer beaches in Sri Lanka (go to Tangalle (my favorite beach town). - food was meh but it was the only option and we were happy to support the local business until we realized what total pieces of sh*t they were. Also, their kids play around and I let one borrow my mask and snorkel (he was very nice) but his brothers (?) friends (?) were throwing rocks (and hitting) people in the water.  I'm guessing they are learning to be jerks by example. - People mention the dogs and these are definitely more aggressive dogs than anywhere else in Sri Lanka.  And guess what?  The people that work at the beach bar kick them and throw coral, rocks and shells at them.  So yeah, they are creating a**hole dogs too.

This is not a very secret beach anymore! Came here 4 years ago & it was a secret beach then, now it‚Äôs on the tourist map it‚Äôs over crowded, no where to sit, full of people snorkelling, sunbeds & spoilt. Don‚Äôt bother with climb to get there you‚Äôll only be disappointed.

The beach was small and honestly overrated. While the sand and the water looked nice, once you got in the water, it was all seaweed and rocks. The worst part of secret beach was when I left and was walking back to my Airbnb, a group of stray dogs attacked/chased after me. I didn‚Äôt provoke them as I was just walking like normal. Be careful when walking to and from secret beach!! The locals came and got me from the dogs and directed me towards a shortcut away from the dogs. I guess the dogs are a growing issue if the locals are having to find different routes..?

We were staying close by and walked down the dreadful potted track to the beach.  The beach was all stony and lumps of coral bits so needed flip flops.  The waves were very strong, so strong they pulled my daughter who is an excellent swimmer under and into rocks covered in sea urchins.  She came out of the sea riddled with spikes and pouring with blood. There was a small area of rock pools but a small child playing here also got sea urchins in her feet.  This was a costly ride to the hospital to have treatment to have all the spikes removed.  The locals know this, apparently it happens all the time, but there is no signs to warn you !! The beach just along the coast on the Mirissa high road is much nicer, sand and easy for swimming.  I would not recommend the secret beach at all.
this part of the beach is at the quiet end to the left of the island...but this is the place that i swum with turtles...so its always going to be a special place to me!

The secret beach itself is gorgeous and definitely worth a visit! Would recommend taking some water shoes or wearing your thongs in as it‚Äôs very rocky/full of coral. I would highly recommend taking your own food + drinks (or eating before or after you go) as the bar there is incredibly average. We waited over an hour for stone cold fries, the pizza we bought tasted like a McCaines frozen pizza (also luke warm), the couple next to us waited over an hour for 2 drinks (and when someone alerted the staff to it they bit back at them). Even getting the bill from them was a mission; we had to wait while all the men smoked and argued amongst each other like we weren‚Äôt there.

Total ripoff. Very poor service. Inflated prices. 500 Rp for an espresso! 500Rp for a subbed even if you're eating there. The owner was rude and nasty. The beach itself is worth a visit.  But stay away from Secret Beach Bar. Bad vibe!
This place is a gem - make the effort to go here during your time in mirissa. The beach is a little stoney but the views more than make up for it - the food and drinks are well priced too
We visited the beach early in the morning which I highly recommend because otherwise it gets too busy. It‚Äôs a bit of a bumpy drive but worth it! Beautiful water two beach bars to drink and eat.
Great staff and great view from this hidden gem which can be a good walk from the city center. Best to go in tuk-tuk because very difficult in a car.

This is  a super beach for relaxing and to  enjoy beach and little bit of snorkeling. The food is great and environment . The journey to the location is an experience . Value  for money  in terms of costs.
Beautiful beach surrounded by palm trees with restaurant. Area for sun beds, friendly staff. A chance to escape the crowds. Delightful
You can find it very easy as it is on the beach! All attractions are across the landline. The pictures are amazing and the landscape is impressive; like all Mirissa :)

It‚Äôs well worth the walk! A tuck tuck will take you most of the way and then there‚Äôs a little walk, getting back you have to walk most of it, get there early and you can rent a couple of loungers for about ¬£4. It‚Äôs a nice little cove so there‚Äôs not much happening but there‚Äôs probably no place better to sit and read a book and have a few drinks

Any Sri Lankan trip is incomplete without visiting this place. This place's beauty and experience is just beyond words. You can just sit here for 2-3 hours just gazing the amazing sea waves and pristine beauty all around and you won't get even bored at all. There is only one restaurant here and not many people visit, which makes it even more surreal and you enjoy the best of it.

It is a bit of a trek to get here on a tuk tuk and then you need to walk 10 minutes although it is nice to get off the main road and see where some of the locals live. The beach has a nice lagoon part which is great for kids to swim in and it is a nice beach but not the best we went to for the effort to get there.

Maybe 20 years ago, but it‚Äôs not a secret now. That being said it still offers a very good snorkeling area although no ones renting them out so bring your own. Nice pools of you just wanna sit around in the water. Be Careful about sea orchids

We went early in the day and had the whole place to ourselves for an hour or so. We took a tuktuk because we stayed slightly out of town, but it's an easy walk - maybe 15min from main town street. There's two spots nearby you can get a drink. The water is nice for swimming. Not much to see snorkeling but a few fish and coral reside there. Mind the coconuts falling from the tree!
We were there in low season (July) and we were almost alone! Very nice to chill a bit away from the crowd!

I dont understand the hype, but now every knows this place. the route to this place is bit difficult since it is twisted roads to find,. but its nice place with strong currents and rocks - not suitable to go swimming,
We had no words to explain the beauty of this place. But we cant leave in this place . we really love this place
Small, beautifull beach with one bar. Good for resting for a bit but not so good for swimming cause for strong waves and nearby rocks.

Not sure what the the hype is about this place. It‚Äôs a long steep uphill walk to a ‚Äòsecret beach‚Äô. You have to constantly tell the local children that you are not going to give them money to be your ‚Äòguide‚Äô. And then when you reach the magical secret beach, it no nicer than any other beach in Mirissa, except it‚Äôs got a very shabby bar on it, staff by people who act like you being there is inconvenient to them. Saw a few other couples on the way home who agreed that it‚Äôs not worth the walk to get to it.
beautiful nature, quiet spot, quiet water, nice beach bar. Probably one of the prettiest beach spots in Sri Lanka.
A hidden gem! A little hard to find but well worth the effort. Nice beach surrounded by the tress, a few people there so you can enjoy the beach nicely
Great little beach that is not easy to find but worth the tuktuk ride. The longer beaches at Mirrissa are bit barren to look at but this has good views, nice breeze and few people. Cool!

I think Sri Lanka is my favourite Destination in the world. And the Secret beach is one of my favourite beaches on the world. IT s in Mirissa a beautiful trek to the Secret beach there is a small bar. The beach is full of Palms. Really really nice.
We had to spend Rp1000 for just 1.8km to go there and there weren‚Äôt anything for the kids to enjoy. Couldn‚Äôt even swim because of the rocks and huge waves

Really recommend this beach with kids. Tuk tuk takes you most of the way then a short walk down to the beach. There is a natural rock breaker giving you a very lovely swimming area. So many hermit crabs which the children adored to play with. Only one restaurant there that have lovely friendly staff and the food was not bad either. Plus we were lucky enough to see a group of monkeys.

Nice and less crowded beach which is like 60-70 Kms from Bentota, better time to visit this beach is post September or October, although there is very less rain in south provenance of Srilanka but to get clean and less noise go in september
It is a secluded beach area located somewhat off the main road. Protect and preserve the beach so that more people can indulge in the serenity of it.
Potentially superb, we went yesterday and the beach bar is being built and the sea was rough. It‚Äôs not quite the lagoon we expected but we know that in high season it could be a hidden gem.

Good food with a beautiful view! We stopped by here for brunch on our way back to Colombo from Mirissa and it definitely was a wise decision. The food was good, wish I was hungrier to try their seafood. Instead I was craving for something sweet and thus had banana and chocolate pancake and passion fruit juice. It was good, the price was reasonable as well.
Say wow on this place. this is like a pool in the sea. very calm place to relaxation. this place not for good surfers
This place is very nice to see. if you going to srilanka this is a best place to rest in beach beach is a very cleanly

Nice quiet remote beach but quite a bit of a walk from town and up the slope , so a tuk tuk will be a better idea. There is a restaurant here but food is so so and a bit pricey compare to restaurant @ Mirissa beach, i guess maybe because they are the only one in this remote beach

This beach is surprisingly not that busy - I guess because you walk quite a bit to get there. So if you look for something quiet in Mirissa, this is a good spot. The beach is full of fine sand, but when you go into the ocean there are quite some rocks and you have to be careful getting in. I did not go in as a had no swimming shoes on me which I would recommend according to sea orchids. The sunset is nece there, but there are a lot of mosquitos
Follow the signs and ask the locals. In fact, it's two sand beaches about 50m long each. There is Secret Beach Bar near one of them. No strong waves, but many stones.
